result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Ivan Santiago-Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court cost, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Defendant to served 10 days in HOC for failure to pay. Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular payments.

The defendant IS ELIGIBLE, after serving 2 years of initial confinement in this case, for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program, after serving 2 years of initial in this case.
Concurrent with: to Count 2, and consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests. Defendant to be tested once per month. 
Complete a parenting course.
Enroll and successfully  complete anger management.
Complete a cognitive intervention program.
Cooperate with rules and regulations of the department.
AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abue Program and IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Concurrent with: Count 1, and consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served

superMiscConds.notes: See Count 1 for Extended Supervision conditions

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Ivan Santiago-Cruz

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (715) 720-3629,  and mailed to:  Department of Corrections, Attn:  Records, 2909 E. Park Avenue, Chippewa Falls, WI  54729.  jm

**BRANCH 28 FOR BRANCH 11**
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP, signed and filed.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  As Br. 11 is not in session, assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DENYING, motionfor sentence credit, and DENYING, motion for relief from judgment.  Order signed and filed.  Copy sent to parties.  aw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. mag
Revocation Order (case 11CF3365) and sentence computation, received and filed.
Defendant's pro se motion for relief from judgment or order.
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (61 pages) commencing AUGUST 6, 2014 received and filed.
NOTICE OF RIGHT TO SEEK POSTCONVICTION RELIEF filed

Defendant Michael Ivan Santiago-Cruz in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Defendant Michael Ivan Santiago-Cruz in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Sentencing proceeded.  PSI reviewed.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS ELIGIBLE, after serving 2 years of initial confinement in this case, for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program, after serving 2 years of initial in this case. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, and CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR, 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program and IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION ON COUNTS 1 AND 2:

- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.  Defendant to be tested once per month.
- Seek and maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.  
- Complete a parenting course.
- Enroll and successfully complete anger management.
- Complete a cognitive intervention program.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Defendant to serve 10 days in HOC for failure to pay.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.
- Cooperate with rules and regulations of the department.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Received and filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw

Defendant Michael Ivan Santiago-Cruz in court with attorney Richard J Smith.  Defendant Michael Ivan Santiago-Cruz in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa.
Case scheduled for motion hearing.  Defendant wishes to resolve the case.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty to both counts. 

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.  Court orders PSI.  Order signed and filed.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 8/6/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed.

Count 1:  Possession with intent to deliver controlled substance (heroin), contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(1m)(d)1, 939.50(3)(f).  A class F felony.

Count 2:  Possession of a firearm by a felon, contrary to WI Stats sec. 941.29(2), 939.50(3)(g).  A  class G felony.

Attorney Richard J. Smith in court, defendant Michael Ivan Santiago-Cruz not in court, in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel would like a Miranda Goodchild hearing.  Case adjourned for final pretrial and motion hearing on 5/8/2014 at 1:30 pm, and for jury trial on 5/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Defense to inform the court if defendant is sent to prison, so they can do an order to prduce the defendant for the next court date.  Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order. aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J. Smith in court, defendant Michael Ivan Santiago-Cruz not in court, in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel needs time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/19/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Michael Ivan Santiago-Cruz in court with attorney Richard J Smith.  Defendant Michael Ivan Santiago-Cruz in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.
Sworn as interpreter:Martha Hernandez.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
